datenbase: {filename} was originally a {document_type}. The document ID is {document_id} and the document title is {document_title}. The original was created by {creator_original}. The data are about excavation area(s) {excavation_object_id} and they are related to {relatedto} and to find material {find_material}. For digital archiving the original {file_extension_original}-file was converted to  {file_extension_archivalobject}-file(s) by {creator_archivalobject} on {creation_date_archivalobject}. Metadata were created on {creation_date_metadata} by {creator_metadata}. The comment during preparation for digital archiving was ‘{digitisation_comment}’. Copyright is held by {copyright}. Access to the file is {access}.
findsheets: The file with the name {filename} is a scan of find sheets ({document_type}) from excavation area {excavation_object_id}. The document ID is {document_id} and the document title is {document_title}. The find sheets were created in {creation_year_original} on {original_material} and are stored at {storage_original} (2019). The scan was made on {creation_date_scan} with a resolution of {resolution_scan_dpi} ppi using a {equipment_scan} scanner. Metadata were created on {creation_date_metadata} by {creator_metadata}. The comment during digitisation was ‘{digitisation_comment}’. Copyright is held by {copyright}. Access to the file is {access}.
archiveinf: The file with the name {filename} contains information about the digital Tell el-Daba (Egypt) documentation archive. autocad: The file with the name {filename} was an AutoCAD file (document type {document_type}). The document ID is {document_id} and the document title is {document_title}. fielddrawing: The file with the name {filename} is a scan of a fielddrawing (type {document_type}) with the inventory number {original_inventory_number}. The document ID is {document_id} and the document title is {document_title}. The fielddrawing was documenting {document_title} and {archaeological_object_id} and {find_inventory_number}. It was drawn in {creation_year_original} by {creator_original}.  The fielddrawing is a drawing in scale {scale} on {original_material}. It is kept in the OREA archive in a folder titled ‘{storage_folder_original}’. The drawer's comment which was written on the fielddrawing was ‘{original_comment}’. The scan was made from the {source_original_copy_edited-copy}. The scan ({file_extension}-file) was made on {creation_date_scan} by {creator_scan}. The scan was made with a {equipment_scan} scanner and a resolution of {resolution_scan_ppi} ppi. Metadata were created on {creation_date_metadata} by {creator_metadata}. The comment during digitisation was ‘{digitisation_comment}’. Copyright is held by {copyright}. Access to the file is {access}.
fotoborndigital: The folder named {folder_name} contains a collection of born-digital photos of (document type {document_type}). The folder ID is {folder_id} and the folder title is {folder_title}. The folder title provides information about the content of the photo collection, which are either photos of finds from a range of find inventory numbers (from/to) or photos of an excavation area. The photos were created in {creation_year_original}. Metadata were created on {creation_date_metadata} by {creator_metadata}. Copyright is held by {copyright}. Access is {access}.
geophysics: File(s) {filename} are data from a geophysical survey. The document ID is {document_id} and the document title is {document_title}. The file(s) contain(s) results from geophysical survey ({method}) in excavation area {excavation_object_id}. It was carried out using a {equipment}. The original file was created on {creation_date_original} by {creator_original}. For digital archiving the original file ({file_extension_original}-file(s)) was/were converted to {file_extension_archivalobject}-file(s) on {creation_date_archivalobject} by {creator_archivalobject}. Metadata were created on {creation_date_metadata} by {creator_metadata}. The comment on the original files was ‘{original_comment}’. Copyright is held by {copyright}. Access to the file is {access}.

fotosgescannt: The file with the name {filename} is a scan of an analogue photo (document type {document_type}). The document ID is {document_id} and the document title is {document_title}. The photo shows archaeological object(s) {archaeological_object_id}, excavation object(s) {excavation_object_id}, find(s) with the inventory number(s) {find_inventory_number} and find type {find_type}. It was made in the year {creation_year_original} by {creator_original}. The number of the analogue photo was {photo_number} in film number {film_number} (film ID {film_id}). The scan was created on {creation_date_scan} by {creator_scan}. The scan ({file_extension}-file) was made with a {equipment_scan} scanner and a resolution of {resolution_scan_ppi} ppi (pixel size {pixel_size}). Metadata were created on {creation_date_metadata} by {creator_metadata}. The comment during digitisation was ‘{digital_comment}’. Copyright is held by {copyright}. Access to the file is {access}.
film: {film_id} is the identifier of photographic film number {film_number}, {addition_film_identifier}. The film is a {document_type}. The film brand is {film_brand} and the film format is {film_format}. The film was used with a {equipment_camera_brand} camera in {creation_year_original}. The comment whether signs of decomposition would be visible on the film was ‘{decomposition_phenomenon}’. The material of the film was probably ‘{original_material}’. The film is stored in the OREA archive in the folder titled {storage_folder_original} (2019). The following photo numbers were missing: {foto_numbers_missing}. Metadata were created on {creation_date_metadata} by {creator_metadata}. The comment during digitisation was ‘{digitisation_comment}’.
inventorybooks: The file with the name {filename} is the scan of a find inventory book (document type {document_type}). The document ID is {document_id} and the document title is {document_title}. The find inventory book provides information about the following find inventory numbers: {find_inventory_number} / bone inventory numbers: {bone_stone_inventory_number}. The find inventory book was created in {creation_year_original} on {original_material}. The comment on the original find inventory book was ‘{original_comment}’. The old filename was {filename_old} and it was stored in a folder titled {storage_folder_original}. Metadata were created on {creation_date_metadata} by {creator_metadata}. Copyright is held by {copyright}. Access to the file is {access}.
convolutecards: The file with the name {filename_document_id} is the scan of a convolute card ({document_type}). The convolute card shows convolute inventory sub-number {convolute_subnumber} which is part of convolute inventory number {convolute_inventory_number}. Access to the file is {access}.
